skillTree.localised_description: The turbulent Winds of Magic can do little harm to those who have found harmony amidst its raging currents.
The best way to repel the chaotic flurry of missile fire is to meet it with order, discipline, and a stalwart row of shields.
Yin-Yin has travelled far and wide through distant, uncharted lands and seas and proudly adorns herself with this bounty of strange wares.
Although a hardened seafarer, Yin-Yin has an unfortunate and almost ill-omened penchant for getting lost on the high seas, so an overtinkered compass never leaves her side.

effects.description:
Attrition: -40% casualties suffered from high seas, reef and storm attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The grand port city of Fu-Chow is renowned for being the cosmopolitan trading hub of the East; merchants of all races come and go to seek their fortune and bringing all sorts of luxurious goods to Cathay.
The Great Dragon Fleet is Yin-Yin's pride and soul, and it is with her implacable war junks and guns that outward threats have been thus far repelled from Cathay's shores.

effects.description:
Ability: "Sky-Junk Carronades" for Sky-Junk units
	(Lord's army)

Reload: +30% for Sky Lantern and Sky-Junk units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: It isn't uncommon for cathayan sailors who have spent their lives exploring the Jade Sea to become unfazed by the hardships on land; afterall, one glance upon their gray eyes can reveal the horrors witnessed at sea.

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

effects.description:
Leadership: +20 when fighting at sea
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: With an emboldening shout, Yin-Yin rouses her crew into a frenzy to overwhelm the enemy with wild abandon.

Yin-Yin, the Sea Dragon, would not have been as successful in her daring exploits without her trusty crew; warriors from all over the Jade Sea's reaches, both friend and foe in the past, now united under her banner.

effects.description:
Unit recruit rank: +2 for Jade Sea Pirates, Dragon Fleet Marines, Ogre Whalers and Sea Dragon's Hatamoto
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +10% for Jade Sea Pirates and Sea Dragon's Hatamoto
	(Lord's army)

Reload: +12% for Dragon Fleet Marines and Ogre Whalers
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Yin-Yin, the Sea Dragon, calls forth her flagship, the Golden Heron, into battle. Although primarily a sea-going vessel, it had been retrofitted in Nan-Gau for flight capabilities so that she could fight anywhere, be it land, sea or air.

An enhanced rocket battery armament as well as more sophisticated stabilizers tinkered by our engineers now ensure that the Golden Heron can fight longer in battle before overheating or suffering from stability issues.

effects.description: Replaces Ability:"Queen of the Jade Sea"

skillTree.localised_description: The warship's standard ordnance have been replaced by powerful flamethrowers and an experimental 'Phoenix Lance' repeater cannon. It has, however, made the vessel extremely susceptible to flame hazards.

effects.description: Replaces Ability:"Queen of the Jade Sea"

skillTree.localised_description: Most of the Golden Heron's offensive capabilities have been stowed away in exchange for more ground support salvos such as flares and military firecrackers, however a lone rocket battery remains at the vessel's bow.

effects.description: Replaces Ability:"Queen of the Jade Sea"

skillTree.localised_description: This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
What weapons can hope to pierce the rigid scales of such a monstrous and majestic beast?
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
The Storm Dragon's every movement is imbued with a predatory swiftness and grace.
A rampage of talons and teeth will carve through the heart of any foe.
This one will not go down easily - it will be necessary to break both the will and the body first.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
The tidal currents shall slow the foe's advance.

target_if: Not on or below a platform
Not on or below a platform

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Tidecall Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: All manner of creatures infest the deep, many who have never - and should never - be seen above the waves.

ui_effects.localised_text: Summons a unit of Rotting Prometheans

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Denizens of the Deep"

This unit can move hidden in any terrain.
If this unit can hide at its current location it will not be spotted until the enemy is very close.

skillTree.localised_description: Once the mighty Kraken's tentacles take hold, only the toughest can fight their way free.

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The Dragon Emperor guides every sword and spear of the northern provinces, inspiring a strength of arms to match an unflinching strength of will.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +4 for Peasant Long Spearmen, Celestial Dragon Guard, Jade Warriors and Jade Warriors (Halberds) units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +4 for Peasant Long Spearmen, Celestial Dragon Guard, Jade Warriors and Jade Warriors (Halberds) units

	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +6 for Peasant Long Spearmen, Celestial Dragon Guard, Jade Warriors and Jade Warriors (Halberds) units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: From lowly peasant to expert marksman, every arrow of the east soars with a Draconic power and grace.

effects.description:

	(Lord's army)

Range: +5% for Peasant Archers, Celestial Dragon Crossbows and Jade Warrior Crossbows units

Missile strength: +9% for Peasant Archers, Celestial Dragon Crossbows and Jade Warrior Crossbows units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Ancient Cathay stands historically unconquered. Booming cannons and rockets of exploding fire help ensure it will remain so.

Ammunition: +5% for Iron Hail Gunners, Crane Gunners, Nan-Gau Grenadiers, Grand Cannon and Fire Rain Rocket units
	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +12% for Iron Hail Gunners, Crane Gunners, Nan-Gau Grenadiers, Grand Cannon and Fire Rain Rocket units

skillTree.localised_description: Who can withstand a charge with the sweeping force of a hundred hooves in unison?

Charge bonus: +12% for Peasant Horsemen, Jade Lancers and Great Longma Riders units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +6% for Peasant Horsemen, Jade Lancers and Great Longma Riders units

Charge bonus: +18% for Peasant Horsemen, Jade Lancers and Great Longma Riders units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Even the most inexperienced peasant rallies under the cold-eyed gaze of Cathay's most stoic guardians.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +4% for Wu Xing War Compass, Zhangu War Drum, Jade Lion, Jet Lion and Terracotta Sentinel units

skillTree.localised_description: When fire hangs in the sky above the battlefield, death is sure to rain down upon it.

Speed: +5% for Sky Lantern, Sky-junk, Onyx Crowmen, Celestial Lion and Great Moon Bird units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +4% for Onyx Crowmen, Celestial Lion and Great Moon Bird units

Missile strength: +12% for Sky Lantern and Sky-junk units

skillTree.localised_description: Cathayan armies have been tested time and again, their skills proven in a tumultuous arena of bloodshed and near-constant war.

effects.description:
Leadership: +6 for Peasant Long Spearmen, Celestial Dragon Guard, Jade Warriors and Jade Warriors (Halberds) units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: When the raging of battle begins, swift hands and swifter feet are the keys to surviving at range.

effects.description:
Missile strength: +6% for Peasant Archers, Celestial Dragon Crossbows, Jade Warrior Crossbows, Iron Hail Gunners, Crane Gunners, Nan-Gau Grenadier, Grand Cannon and Fire Rain Rocket units (Rank 7 and above)

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Swift, steady and moving as one, the hardy warriors of Cathay race headlong into battle.

effects.description:
Speed: +10% for Peasant Horsemen, Jade Lancers, Great Longma Riders, Terracotta Sentinel, Jade Lion, Jet Lion, Celestial Lion, Wu Xing War Compass and Zhangu War Drum units (Rank 7 and above)

skillTree.localised_description: A blanket of glowing lights amidst the clouds is sure to stir the heart of every Cathayan warrior beneath them.

effects.description:
Leadership: +6 for Sky Lantern, Sky-junk, Onyx Crowmen and Great Moon Bird units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Range: +15% for Sky Lantern and Sky-junk units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: 15% for Sky Lantern, Sky-junk, Onyx Crowmen and Great Moon Bird units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
This Lord expects utter obedience from the smallfolk, and has little time for insurrections or petty revolts.
All warriors of honour and pride are eager to fight under the Dragon-Emperor's banners.
The presence of this Lord ensures a measure of calm, reducing panic and desertion amongst followers.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Through our acts, the gods will cleanse the lands.
Every wound that is not fatal is but a lesson to learn from.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +30% for this Lord
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +250 metres without incurring any time penalty
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +600 metres without incurring any time penalty
Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +1000 metres without incurring any time penalty

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
Proficient with figures, this Lord, or his subordinates, can keep his army fulfilled, even in dire circumstances.
Countless conflicts and a keen sense of awareness have made this Lord difficult to entrap.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +5%
Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +10%

skillTree.localised_description: The blood-soaked battlefields of the northern provinces are the proving grounds upon which the mightiest warriors of Cathay have honed their craft.

effects.description:
Recruit rank: +2 for all units
	(Lord's army)

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
When two or more units in the same army share this attribute,  intensity increases the power of spells cast.

target_if: Unit is not Lord or Hero

attributes.bullet_text:
A Rampaging unit is uncontrollable and will attack the nearest enemy unit.
	When there are no enemy units nearby, a Rampaging unit will move around randomly instead.

ui_effects.localised_text: Activates when within 60 metres of a Yang unit.
Effect intensity increases by highest nearby Harmony multiplier on a unit.

factionEffects.localised_description: Daring, ambitious, and a bit foolhardy, Yin-Yin, the Sea Dragon braves all the world's seas to spread the radiance of Grand Cathay. Backed by the mighty Grand Dragon Fleet, the Sea Dragon is ready to face foreign shores and stranger waters.

effects.description: Has access to unique landmarks in province capitals around Lustria
Missile damage: +15% for Dragon Fleet Marines
Diplomatic relations : -60 with Dark Elves and Lizardmen

backgroundSkills.localised_name: Admiral of the Grand Dragon Fleet
backgroundSkills.localised_description: The Sea Dragon commands the Grand Dragon Fleet of Cathay and is the proud defender of her shores.

effects.description:
Leadership: +6 when in foreign territory
	(Lord's army)

This unit can move hidden in any terrain.
